name: sequence
name of the alias that is used to play t: used to uniquely identify alias entries when more than one sound goes to an alias, used only to catch unwanted duplicates (default = 0)

name: file
name of the alias that is used to play t: the name of the file that contains the sound data (required)

name: vol_min
name of the alias that is used to play t: 0 is silent, 1 is full volume (default = 1)

name: vol_max
name of the alias that is used to play t: 0 is silent, 1 is full volume (default = same as vol_min)

name: vol_mod
name of the alias that is used to play t: blank causes no effect on vol_min and vol_max, otherwise the string must match a string in the volumemodgroups.def file and the value in that file corresponding to that string will be used to adjust vol_min and vol_max, clamped to the valid range

name: pitch_min
name of the alias that is used to play t: 1 is normal playback, 2 is twice as fast, 0.5 is half as fast (default = 1)

name: pitch_max
name of the alias that is used to play t: 1 is normal playback, 2 is twice as fast, 0.5 is half as fast (default = same as pitch_min)

name: dist_min
name of the alias that is used to play t: within this distance in inches, the sound is always full volume (default = 120)

name: dist_max
name of the alias that is used to play t: outside this distance in inches, the sound is not started.  If left blank or set to 0, the sound will play from any distance.  This does not affect sound volume falloff.

name: channel
name of the alias that is used to play t: auto, menu, weapon, voice, item, body, local, music, announcer (default = auto)

name: type
name of the alias that is used to play t: primed (a streamed sound which gets primed on some platforms) / streamed / loaded (default = loaded)

name: probability
name of the alias that is used to play t: weight to use for the weighted probability of playing this sound instead of another sound (default = 1)

name: loop
name of the alias that is used to play t: whether this sound is "looping" or "nonlooping" (default = "nonlooping")

name: masterslave
name of the alias that is used to play t: if "master", this is a master sound.  If a number, then this sound's volume will be multiplied by that number (a percentage between 0 and 1) any master sound is playing.  If blank, then neither master nor slave.

name: loadspec
name of the alias that is used to play t: space-separated list of which maps should use this alias; eg, "burnville dawnville".  If blank, the alias is used on all maps.

name: compression
name of the alias that is used to play t: a string corresponding to an entry in "XMAUpdate.tbl" which is used to determine compression by XMAUpdate.exe

name: secondaryaliasname
name of the alias that is used to play t: defined the name of an additional sound alias to play in addition to the current alias being played. Note that it is an error for the secondaryalias to also define a secondaryaliasname (eg, if B is a secondaryalias of A, B is not allowed to have its own secondaryalias).

name: volumefalloffcurve
name of the alias that is used to play t: if blank uses the linear curve which can not be changed. A string 'XXXX' corresponds to the curve defined by the file 'soundaliases/XXXX.vfcurve'

name: startdelay
name of the alias that is used to play t: defaults to no delay. The value is the number of milliseconds to delay starting the sound by

name: speakermap
name of the alias that is used to play t: if blank uses the default speakermappings which cannot be changed. A string 'XXXX' corresponds to the speakermap defined by the file 'soundaliases/XXXX.spkrmap'.

name: reverb
name of the alias that is used to play t: blank means the alias is affected normally by wet and dry levels, "fulldrylevel" forces the alias to use a full drylevel (ignoring the global drylevel), "nowetlevel" forces the alias to use no wetlevel (ignoring the global wetlevel)

name: lfe percentage
name of the alias that is used to play t: this determines what percentage of the highest calculated spatialized speaker volume should be passed to the LFE. blank means no LFE for the sound

name: center percentage
name of the alias that is used to play t: this determines what percentage of the volume should be redirected to the center channel (equal percentage taken from all speakers).

name: platform
name of the alias that is used to play t: used by XMAUpdate to determine whether the alias should be processed for a particular platform.  If blank, process for all platforms.  Platforms are PC, XB, PS, WI.  Multiple values should be separated by spaces.  !PC will exclude alias from PC but include in all other platforms.  PC will only include alias for PC.  !PC XB is invalid.

name: envelop_min
name of the alias that is used to play t: any sounds within this distance of the listener will use the full envelop percentage

name: envelop_max
name of the alias that is used to play t: sounds between enevlop_min and envelop_max use a fraction of the envelop percentage

name: envelop percentage
name of the alias that is used to play t: amount of omnidirectionality to apply

name: sequence
name of the alias that is used to play t: file
weapons/f2000/weap_f2000_sdst_01.wav
weapons/f2000/weap_f2000_sdmn_01.wav
